page.title: 08FARMING _ TYPES
page.content: {Farming}is by far the most important land use within our Domesday block and accounts for up to{80%}of the block area. There are{17}farms included within its boundaries, the largest being{Appledore}(295 acres) and the smallest{Frogwell}(99 acres) The average size is 149 acres. The type of farming carried out reflects enviromental factors, such as local climate, relief, soils, farm size and important economic factors such as the present EEC Common Agricultural Policy and market demand. Thus 14 of the 17 farms are mixed farms, whilst{Durnaford}is a dairy farm,{Merryhue Park}a beef farm and {Coombe}a dairy/sheep farm. Other farms do have specialisations, such as {Pencrebar}where 1000 pedigree Landrace pigs are bred and reared.
